cs351.project1

Class ZombieHouseRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs351.project1.ZombieHouseRenderer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Renderer

    public class ZombieHouseRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Renderer
    Zombie house renderer. Maintains and rebuilds the scene each frame.
    Author:
    Justin Hall

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ZombieHouseRenderer(javafx.stage.Stage stage, int width, int height)
      This constructor will initialize itself, create a new scene with its renderSceneGroup and then set the stage's scene to it.

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(Engine engine,
                   javafx.scene.shape.DrawMode mode,
                   double deltaSeconds)
        Description copied from interface: Renderer
        When this is called this will walk through all of the actors that have been registered with it and render them relative to the player.
        Specified by:
        render in interface Renderer
        Parameters:
        engine - reference to the current engine
        mode - if this is set to DrawMode.FILL the objects will appear solid, but if this is set to DrawMode.LINE everything will look like it is a wire-frame model

      • registerPlayer

        public void registerPlayer(Actor player,
                           double fieldOfView)
        Description copied from interface: Renderer
        This is how you let the renderer know which actor is the player in the scene. It will automatically attach a camera to this actor.
        Specified by:
        registerPlayer in interface Renderer
        Parameters:
        player - the game's player
        fieldOfView - this determines how much the player can see on the screen - normal FOV is 45.0 degrees and a large FOV is 90.0 degrees

      • registerActor

        public void registerActor(Actor actor,
                          javafx.scene.shape.Shape3D shape,
                          javafx.scene.paint.Color diffuseColor,
                          javafx.scene.paint.Color specularColor,
                          javafx.scene.paint.Color ambientColor)
        Description copied from interface: Renderer
        Registers an Actor object with the renderer. What this does is to basically map an Actor object to an object that should be rendered in the world. Shape3D can be things like a sphere, box, etc. (any valid Shape3D from JavaFX). This should be used for all Actor objects, whether they move or don't move.
        Specified by:
        registerActor in interface Renderer
        Parameters:
        actor - object to add to the scene
        shape - shape of the object
        diffuseColor - this is the color the object scatters in all directions when light hits it
        specularColor - this is the color the object reflects in one direction when light hits it - results in a shiny circles on the surface
        ambientColor - base color of the object

      • registerActor

        public void registerActor(Actor actor,
                          RenderEntity entity,
                          javafx.scene.paint.Color diffuseColor,
                          javafx.scene.paint.Color specularColor,
                          javafx.scene.paint.Color ambientColor)
        Description copied from interface: Renderer
        Registers an Actor object with the renderer. This function requires a TriangleMesh which allows you to load in a 3D model that is different from the standard Shape3D objects.
        Specified by:
        registerActor in interface Renderer
        Parameters:
        actor - object to add to the scene
        entity - object with all the mesh/animation data
        diffuseColor - this is the color the object scatters in all directions when light hits it
        specularColor - this is the color the object reflects in one direction when light hits it - results in a shiny circles on the surface
        ambientColor - base color of the object

      • mapTextureToActor

        public void mapTextureToActor(java.lang.String textureFile,
                              Actor actor)
        Description copied from interface: Renderer
        This should be used for all Actor objects that need to be textured.
        Specified by:
        mapTextureToActor in interface Renderer
        Parameters:
        textureFile - name of the texture file to be loaded
        actor - object to associate the texture with when rendering
